nachos.machine

Class CPU

  • java.lang.Object
    • nachos.machine.CPU
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MIPS

    public abstract class CPU
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this class represents an individual CPU. The public methods provided by this class are mostly static methods that operate on the "current CPU", which is the CPU on which the caller is executing. Most of the rest of the methods are only for the internal use of the simulation, and for that reason they are package private. The reason for this is that it generally only makes sense for code running in the kernel to manipulate the state of the CPU on which the code is running, not the state of some other CPU.

    • Method Detail

      • currentCPU

        public static CPU currentCPU()
        Determine the CPU on which we are currently running. This works if execution is in an interrupt handlers as well as if it is in a thread context.
        Returns:
        the CPU on which we are currently running.

      • getName

        public static java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the CPU on which we are currently running.
        Returns:
        the name of the CPU on which we are currently running, or null if the current CPU has not been set, as is the case when the system is booting up.

      • getLevel

        public static int getLevel()
        Determine the current interrupt level.
        Returns:
        the current interrupt level.

      • setLevel

        public static int setLevel(int level)
        Change interrupts to be enabled or disabled. Changing from interrupts disabled to interrupts enabled will trigger interrupt processing, in which case this method will not return until interrupt processing has completed.
        Parameters:
        level - The new interrupt status.
        Returns:
        The old interrupt status.

      • getMode

        public static int getMode()
        Determine the current mode (idle, kernel, user) of execution.
        Returns:
        The current execution mode.

      • setPageTable

        public static void setPageTable(TranslationEntry[] table)
        Set the page table to be used by the MMU for address translation.
        Parameters:
        table - The page table to be set.

      • setExceptionHandler

        public static void setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler handler)
        Method called by the OS to register an exception handler to be used when a machine exception occurs in user mode.
        Parameters:
        handler - Exception handler to be registered.

      • readRegister

        public static int readRegister(int num)
        Read the contents of a specified user-mode register of the current CPU.
        Parameters:
        num - The number of the register to be read.
        Returns:
        The value stored in the specified register.

      • writeRegister

        public static void writeRegister(int num,
                                 int value)
        Change the contents of a specified user-mode register of the current CPU.
        Parameters:
        num - The number of the register to be written.
        value - The value to be stored in the specified register.

      • runUserCode

        public static void runUserCode()
        Method called by a thread to begin execution in user mode. It should only be called once, the first time the thread enters user mode. After that, entry to the kernel can only be via an interrupt handler or an exception handler, and return to user mode should be accomplished simply by returning from the handler.

      • dispatch

        public void dispatch(NachosThread thread)
        Dispatch a thread on an idle CPU.
        Parameters:
        thread - The thread to dispatch.

      • idle

        public static void idle(Releasable toRelease)
        Relinquish the current CPU, which will become idle. This method must be called with interrupts disabled on the current CPU. This method does not return until the calling thread has been rescheduled, perhaps on another CPU.
        Parameters:
        toRelease - If non-null, a lock held by the caller that should be released as the CPU is set idle.

      • switchTo

        public static void switchTo(NachosThread nextThread,
                            Releasable toRelease)
        Switch this CPU from the currently executing thread to another thread. This method must be called with interrupts disabled on the current CPU. This method does not return until the calling thread has been rescheduled, perhaps on another CPU.
        Parameters:
        nextThread - The thread to switch to.
        toRelease - If non-null, a lock held by the caller that should be released atomically with relinquishing the CPU.

      • setCPUExceptionHandler

        public void setCPUExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler handler)
        Set the handler to be used by this CPU when an exception occurs in user mode. The only reason this is public and not protected is so that the first thread can initialize all CPUs without having to create a separate thread to initialize each CPU.
        Parameters:
        handler - Exception handler to be registered.

      • setOnInterruptReturn

        public static void setOnInterruptReturn(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Method called from an interrupt handler to set kernel code to be executed upon completion of current interrupt processing. This is used to allow interrupt handlers to request rescheduling of the CPU.
